title: Question:
author: mikechabot276
content: Hello,I'm selling luxsock.su accounts. Those who are interested can reach out. account registration fee is $500.I'm selling it for $200.Contact: Telegram @Mikechabot69

comments.author: Tespata
comments.body: After purchasing any type of ID, there are many types of problems later, I have seen many such incidents happening recently.I think creating your own ID is much safer than buying someone else's ID and using it.I myself was involved in a similar incident after purchasing an ID from someone else who was unable to use the ID later and had no way of contacting the person from whom I purchased it becomes risky.We each have a duty to protect each other's trust so we can transact safely

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: What is the point of activating the account using $500 and then selling it off for only $200?Something is fishy here. Probably a scamFirst, when the account is being created, there is an option to enter a memo which can only be used by the owner to recover the account. Buyer won't know about this.Account should also not be used by multiple users. This is against the TOS and could lead to the termination of the account.QuoteTerms of ServiceUser must not:    Use one account by multiple users; share account access to other users;

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: Do you mean when you created an account here on luxsock you paid 500$? Am I correct in my understanding? Who in their right mind would buy the account you are selling?    Then I discovered that the website you provided has a high chance of being a phishing site that you are selling an account to, possibly a phishing site. It is unfortunate for the ignorant person who buys that account, I suggest that you do not be tricked into transacting with OP because he is obviously a scammer or hacker, this is what appeared on my desktop. Good thing I have karspersky to detect if the website is suspicious or a phishing site or a threat to your computer.BEWARE of this site....

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: bettercrypto on February 23, 2023, 09:12:02 AMDo you mean when you created an account here on luxsock you paid 500$? Am I correct in my understanding? Who in their right mind would buy the account you are sellingHe's definitely trying to scam members here or carry out some social engineering, but the former is more likely. Who in this terrible state of economy can just sacrifice $300 to just sell already activated accounts to internet strangers?Nobody, except a scammer, try to sell to you an imaginary account and imaginary USD.

comments.author: PiterFind
comments.body: Luxsocks are still working? Looks suspicious.

comments.author: worldofcoins
comments.body: I strongly advise being vigilant before purchasing any accounts, mainly if they are being sold at a discounted price by a third-party seller—for example, Luxsock. Su is an online marketplace claiming to sell luxury items, and it is unclear why someone would be selling accounts for this platform.
